metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3842 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In systemd before v242-rc4, it was discovered that pam_systemd does not properly sanitize the environment before using the XDG_SEAT variable. It is possible for an attacker, in some particular configurations, to set a XDG_SEAT environment variable which allows for commands to be checked against polkit policies using the "allow_active" element rather than "allow_any".

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3842` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-myhostname - 229-4ubuntu21.21
libnss-mymachines - 229-4ubuntu21.21
libnss-resolve - 229-4ubuntu21.21
libpam-systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.21
libsystemd0 - 229-4ubuntu21.21
libudev1 - 229-4ubuntu21.21
systemd - 229-4ubuntu21.21
systemd-container - 229-4ubuntu21.21
systemd-coredump - 229-4ubuntu21.21
systemd-journal-remote - 229-4ubuntu21.21
systemd-sysv - 229-4ubuntu21.21
udev - 229-4ubuntu21.21
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: systemd package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '229-4ubuntu21.21').
